activity-date.narrative: Planned start date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
Planned end date of the activity

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement: Critical positions to be filled at each EPI unit at provincial level | Description: Each province shall, by nolater than three (3) months after the Effective Date, appoint and maintain, throughout the period of implementation of the Project,critical positions including FM, procurement, M&E, Surveillance, Data Management, Epidemiologist, with appropriate qualificationsand experience.

Finance Agreement: Establishment and implementation of bi-annual review meetings at federal level | Description: The Federal EPICell shall establish by no later than two (2) weeks after the Effective Date, and thereafter maintain, throughout the period ofimplementation of the Project, a bi-annual review meeting at federal level headed by the National Program Manager of the FederalEPI cell, and comprised of the provincial EPI program managers from each of the four provinces.
MONHSRC to maintain (i) a Federal Steering Committee; and (ii) a Federal EPI Cell, and each DoH of each Province to maintainProvincial EPI Steering Committees and Provincial EPI Cells.

(i) Federal EPI Cell to hire a financial management specialist, a procurement specialist, a monitoring, evaluation and surveillancespecialist, a data management technician and an epidemiologist; and (ii) Provincial EPI Cells to hire a financial reportingspecialist, all under TORs, and with qualification and experience acceptable to the WB.

MONHSRC to convene ICC meetings with provincial EPI Cells, representatives of Donors and the WB, and Provinces to ensure theattendance of ICC Meetings by the respective managers of the provincial EPI Cells.
MONHSRC to carry out its respective parts of the Project in accordance with the Procurement Manual, and refrain from unilaterallyamending, suspending or waiving the provisions of such Manual.

MONHSRC to prepare and adopt a national level policy framework for the financing of immunization services setting forthimmunization targets and annual resources requirements, and thereafter make annual budgetary appropriations for EPI services on thebasis of the approved policy.

MONHSRC and Provinces to prepare, adopt and carry out an implementation plan for the strengthening of the financial managementcapacity of MONHSRC, its Federal EPI Cell, the provincial DoHs and their respective EPI Cells.
MONHSRC and the Provinces to undertake DLI verification processes in accordance with the terms of reference agreed with the WB.
MONHSRC to categorize all HR positions created on the development budget as per the Federal PC-I as part of the recurrent budget.
MONHSRC to enter into a purchase agreement with UNICEF for the provision of cold rooms, ice lined refrigerators and relatedequipment for the storage and transport of vaccines.
MONHSRC and the Project Provinces to carry out their respective Project activities in accordance with the ESMP.
MONHSRC to establish and thereafter maintain a procurement documentation and record keeping system, and a mechanism for thehandling of procurement complaints.

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

title.narrative: Percent of children aged between 12-23 months in the province or territory who are fully immunized
Percentage of districts in each province reporting coverage of >80% Penta3 in children between 12-23 months which have these reports validated
Drop-out rate between Penta1 and Penta3 in each province
Penta3 coverage in each province between the lowest and the highest wealth quintile
Percentage of Districts in each province with at least 80% timeliness and completeness reporting on vLMIS
Percentage of UC in each province for which revised computerized UC level micro plans are in functional use at district and provincial levels
Percentage of districts in each province with functional cold chain equipment in place as per specifications >95% in each tier of health system
Number of contracts by each province with CSOs for provision of immunization services in urban slums awarded
Percentage of children under two years of age with vaccination card available
Percentage of secure districts in each province with functional electronic tracking of the vaccinators and supervisors
Percentage of districts in each province with their recognized surveillance sites having functional online surveillance for VaccinePreventable Diseases & Adverse Events Following Immunization
Percentage of total combined number of EDOs/EDO(H) in each province EDOs/EDO(H)s have attended MLM courses
Percentage of UC in each province with at least two skilled staff capable of providing immunization
People who have received essential health, nutrition, and population (HNP) services
Percentage of detailed UC supervisory plans implemented by District supervisors and made available to supervisor officers in each Project Province
